name: politico
text:

name: politico
text:

https://t.co/iVKntIJO87

name: politico
text:
With each passing day, a vaccine is getting closer. A shot may be approved on the early side of Fauci’s 12-to 18-month time frame.

Should this happen, the achievement is partly because of the hard work from research teams. But it’s also involved some luck
https://t.co/1ErkXjL2Bk

name: politico
text:
Members of the conservative House Freedom Caucus are quietly working to convince GOP leadership to sign off on a long-shot bid to oust Nancy Pelosi from the speakership, according to multiple sources

https://t.co/OBGwKhGvxF

name: politico
text:
Mick Mulvaney, President Trump’s former acting chief of staff, will soon make his first trip to the British Isles in his new role as the U.S. special envoy for Northern Ireland.

He is expected to go to Belfast, Dublin and London in the next few weeks 
https://t.co/1LaFHzyCKV

name: politico
text:
Trump has never been fond of retail politics, like the random visit to a coffee shop or diner. The majority of his interactions with supporters comes from rallies. 

Just 48 days from the election, the risks of that approach are becoming clearer https://t.co/zMr3jJVVLy

name: politico
text:
Gov. Gavin Newsom insisted today that California's coronavirus rules do not prohibit NCAA football.

Schools “can resume football," he said. "There’s nothing in the guidelines saying the Pac-12 cannot move forward”
https://t.co/i3Pa5ZyzVE

name: politico
text:
Donald Trump is scrambling his defenses in states like Ohio and Iowa, where he was once expected to win easily. 

Yet he’s also competing hard in others, such as Minnesota and Nevada, that were once viewed as far out of his reach
https://t.co/nxUZfn72KL

name: politico
text:
Deaths attributed to Alzheimer’s disease and dementia rose to more than 20% above normal over the summer. 

It's a staggering figure that won’t factor into the official count of coronavirus deaths but is unmistakably linked to the pandemic’s true toll
https://t.co/3a3lzMvIKc

text:

text: Yesterday, the clutch of middle-of-the-road Democrats who made Nancy Pelosi speaker said she was to blame for months of inaction on Covid relief. But then, President Donald Trump suggested he wanted a giant relief deal — just like Pelosi. https://t.co/1YodNbAoa0

name: politico
text: Opinion: Overlooking rural and blue-collar voters could jeopardize Democrats’ ability to win the swing states that delivered the election to Donald Trump in 2016 https://t.co/8PAez7U8K1

text: The top spokesperson for HHS, Michael Caputo, says he's taking a leave of absence for health reasons — less than a week after POLITICO first reported that he was interfering with CDC reports on coronavirus. We take you behind the story on POLITICO Dispatch https://t.co/o1yaNayVt7

text: At a contentious bar ethics hearing this week, conservative gadfly Larry Klayman produced Zoom testimony from a parade of right-wing personalities to back him including 2 former GOP presidential candidates Alan Keyes and Bob Barr https://t.co/rzFHp4BiZ3

name: politico
text: Rep. James Clyburn, D-S.C., the No. 3 House Dem leader, said that Barr’s remarks were “the most ridiculous, tone-deaf, God-awful things I’ve ever heard” because they wrongly equated human bondage with a measure aimed at saving lives https://t.co/oOo7BrpAtC https://t.co/imcgSjeOCv

text: NYC Mayor Bill de Blasio has agreed to delay the opening of in-person schooling of the nation’s largest school district — again — after teachers and principals had raised a host of objections including safety concerns https://t.co/atksEkW35t

name: politico
text: Attorneys for Scott Atlas threatened to sue the people who signed an open letter denouncing his qualifications for his role on the White House’s #Covid response team if they didn't retract their statements https://t.co/vA3uvB9gPU

name: politico
text: More than three years after first promising to raise taxes on New Jersey‘s millionaires — an issue helped sour his relationship with the Legislature and nearly led to a state government shutdown — Gov. Phil Murphy is about to get his wish https://t.co/OwRev7t8Kk

name: politico
text: Last week dozens of doctors and researchers affiliated with Stanford University signed a letter slamming Atlas, who worked as a senior fellow at its Hoover Institution, saying they had a responsibility to denounce his optimistic outlook on #Covid19 https://t.co/vA3uvB9gPU

name: politico
text: “Many of his opinions and statements run counter to established science and, by doing so, undermine public-health authorities and the credible science that guides effective public health policy,” the letter states https://t.co/vA3uvB9gPU

name: politico
text:
Atlas does not appear to have a background in public health, epidemiology or infectious diseases.

He has specialized in radiology and neuroradiology, including serving as chief of neuroradiology at Stanford University Medical Center https://t.co/vA3uvB9gPU
